DOC.brief_summary: Partial Nephrectomy is the standard care for small (<4 cm) renal tumors. Despite the expanding use of laparoscopic approach, debate exist regarding the short and long term outcomes compared to the open approach. Our goal is to perform a prospective randomized trial to compare these methods
DOC.brief_title: Laparoscopic Versus Open Partial Nephrectomy - Surgical and Oncological Outcomes
DOC.criteria: patients referred to partial nephrectomy Contraindication for laparocopic surgery Complexed , large tumors, single kidney, chronic renal failure
DOC.keyword: Renal tumor, RCC, Partial nephrectomy, Laparoscopy
